metadata.title: Gender pension gap costs retired women over four months of payments, research finds

left: Retired women go over four months each year without pension income due to the gender gap, according to research from the TUC.
The average loss for retired women is estimated at £7,600 annually because of this gap.
The income gap for retirees between men and women is now 36.5%, as reported by the Prospect union.
Paul Nowak of the TUC emphasized the need to address these inequalities for future generations.
